intro: Amsinckia hallii, commonly known as the desert sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its bright yellow, daisy-like flowers and hairy, lobed leaves adapted to arid environments. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is drought-tolerant, making it well-suited for desert habitats. Its flowering period occurs in the summer months, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Amsinckia hallii plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and supporting local biodiversity.
